reviews.review_msg: There was a lot of reading in this class, especially ethnographies. We had four 750-word assignments which were fairly easy and the midterm and final were online which was helpful. Attending lecture and tutorial counted toward our participation mark though. Overall it was alright but be prepared for a lot of reading for a first-year course.
Extremely rude and does not make sense when she lectures. Avoid taking this class.

This was taught as a third-year course that specialized in ethnobotany. Avoid this professor if you're looking for a genuine introduction to anthropology. There were also three mandatory textbooks; the most expensive was the least used.

It was not that bad, just make sure if you have any questions (Like ANY, even small questions), ask her and she will give you a detailed explanation. The lectures are not that important, to be honest.

Natasha was great in giving great feedbacks to her students, and was a very easy person to approach as she is very passionate and caring person. Th readings are not dense, and quite very long so please be aware of that. The more you get in the class discussion the more your absorb the information. A lot of group discussion which is great!

Lunatic who pushes alternative medicine, is very annoying & insecure and uses needlessly complicated language to explain topics that do not need it. Has unreasonable expectations : Your final essay should be 8-10 pages in length", choose a topic by the end of week 1 and begin your research week 2 (you will need time to read a lot of articles)."

I have taken two classes with Natasha (SA101 & SA356W) and she is such a passionate and caring professor. You can clearly see her love of her work through her lectures and stories she shares. The readings are not dense, and fairly short. Natasha always has a smile on her face as she teaches and it is contagious. 10/10

The course material is very interesting but the way the Professor teaches makes it very hard to understand. The lectures are long and very boring and they do not help you understand the course material. I do not recommend taking this class.

I am currently in my 3rd course with Dr. Ferenczi (I've taken SA101, SA301 & SA356W) & she is truly such a wonderful person. SA101 in particular was my least favourite, as large class sizes and all TA marking make you feel really distanced from her as a person, but in SA301 & SA356W she is super involved & personal with your learning. Love her!

This class was honestly one of the hardest ones I've taken. For an introductory class, the reading for the second part of the term was extremely hard and very random. The class is abstract and really confusing. The grading was way too harsh, especially on the weekly discussions. The teacher focused too much on her own research.
I really enjoyed Dr. Ferenczi has great explanatory lectures but is very reading-heavy. Just do the readings and ask the TAs questions and you'll do well.

She's nice enough, but more than once she made a super expensive, not easily accessible textbook mandatory for a few writings and then you're done with it. I've put the most time into this course and it has been my worst academic class. There's always something due, and unless you've had her before it's really hard to know whats expected of you.

Do not take this class! The class is super lecture and reading heavy and attendance is mandatory. Lectures are super long and boring and hard to understand. The content in the second half of the course is so abstract and random. 3 textbooks required, and the one you focus on is so stupid. Proff seems passive aggressive sometimes and marks hard.
